Zen.q: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
Zen.h:
“Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.” —
Sun Tzu

Zen.q: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
Zen.h:
“No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.” —
Albert Einstein

Zen.q: As you think, so shall you become.
Zen.h:
“As you think, so shall you become. ” —
Bruce Lee

Zen.q: Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.
Zen.h:
“Treat every moment as your last. It is not preparation for something else.” —
Shunryu Suzuki

Zen.q: Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.
Zen.h:
“Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.” —
Naval Ravikant

Zen.q: Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.
Zen.h:
“Hope and fear come from feeling that we lack something; they come from a sense of poverty.” —
Pema Chodron

Zen.q: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
Zen.h:
“He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary. ” —
Seneca

Zen.q: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
Zen.h:
“Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.” —
Mother Teresa

Zen.q: Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.
Zen.h:
“Never be afraid to raise your voice for honesty and truth and compassion against injustice and lying and greed.” —
William Faulkner

Zen.q: Change yourself - you are in control.
Zen.h:
“Change yourself - you are in control.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

Zen.q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
Zen.h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.” —
Steve Jobs

Zen.q: It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.
Zen.h:
“It is under the greatest adversity that there exists the greatest potential for doing good, both for oneself and others.” —
Dalai Lama

Zen.q: Success is not what you do when you are on top.  Success is how high you bounce when you hit the bottom.
Zen.h:
“Success is not what you do when you are on top. Success is how high you bounce when you hit the bottom.” —
Sonia Ricotti

Zen.q: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
Zen.h:
“The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.” —
Ayn Rand

Zen.q: Ability is a poor man's wealth.
Zen.h:
“Ability is a poor man's wealth.” —
John Wooden

Zen.q: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
Zen.h:
“Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.” —
Sydney Smith

Zen.q: Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully.
Zen.h:
“Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully. ” —
Zig Ziglar

Zen.q: To do two things at once is to do neither.
Zen.h:
“To do two things at once is to do neither.” —
Publilius Syrus

Zen.q: Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.
Zen.h:
“Those who look for the bad in people will surely find it.” —
Abraham Lincoln

Zen.q: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
Zen.h:
“Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.” —
Og Mandino

Zen.q: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
Zen.h:
“A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.” —
Jonathan Swift

Zen.q: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
Zen.h:
“Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.” —
Mark Twain

Zen.q: Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.
Zen.h:
“Don't put off living to next week, next month, next year or next decade. The only time you're ever living is in this moment.” —
Celestine Chua

Zen.q: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
Zen.h:
“No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.” —
F. Scott Fitzgerald

Zen.q: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
Zen.h:
“It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.” —
Will Rogers

Zen.q: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
Zen.h:
“Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.” —
John D. Rockefeller

Zen.q: You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.
Zen.h:
“You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose.” —
Dr. Seuss

Zen.q: If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup.
Zen.h:
“If you put water into a cup, it becomes the cup.” —
Bruce Lee

Zen.q: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
Zen.h:
“It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going. ” —
Brian Tracy

Zen.q: Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance.
Zen.h:
“Truth will always be truth, regardless of lack of understanding, disbelief or ignorance. ” —
W. Clement Stone

Zen.q: Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.
Zen.h:
“Avoiding failure is to avoid progress.” —
Unknown

Zen.q: Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.
Zen.h:
“Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.” —
Alexandre Dumas

Zen.q: Growth comes at the point of resistance.
Zen.h:
“Growth comes at the point of resistance.” —
Josh Waitzkin

Zen.q: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
Zen.h:
“You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.” —
A.A. Milne

Zen.q: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
Zen.h:
“Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence. ” —
George Washington

Zen.q: People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.
Zen.h:
“People don't care how much you know until they know how much you care.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

Zen.q: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
Zen.h:
“If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

Zen.q: Don't let the past steal your present.
Zen.h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

Zen.q: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
Zen.h:
“The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.” —
Steve Maraboli

Zen.q: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
Zen.h:
“Whoever is happy will make others happy too.” —
Anne Frank

Zen.q: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
Zen.h:
“Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.” —
Babe Ruth

Zen.q: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
Zen.h:
“I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.” —
Amelia Earhart

Zen.q: Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you.
Zen.h:
“Never do to others what you would not like them to do to you. ” —
Confucius

Zen.q: The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.
Zen.h:
“The one who praises you is a thief. The one who criticizes you is your true friend.” —
Seungsahn

Zen.q: Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.
Zen.h:
“Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.” —
Ralph Marston

Zen.q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
Zen.h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

Zen.q: Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.
Zen.h:
“Most people dabble their way through life, never deciding to master anything in particular.” —
Tony Robbins

Zen.q: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
Zen.h:
“If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.” —
Mother Teresa

Zen.q: Every experience is a lesson. Every loss is a gain.
Zen.h:
“Every experience is a lesson. Every loss is a gain.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

Zen.q: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
Zen.h:
“Opportunities multiply as they are seized.” —
Sun Tzu
